TopicTitle: Calling all Real Solar System - Realism Overhaul Players !!! :)

Articles.Content:
Hi guys! Hope everyone's doing great!

Maybe this has already been posted/suggested in the forums but if so I'll say it again!

Is it not time that we have a Realism Hub in this forum to discuss all RSS-Realism Overhaul related stuff? I am an assiduous RSS/RO player (in fact I have never played stock KSP - I started with RSS/RO right from the start [man, was that tough!]) and became almost obsessed with turning my KSP into the real thing.

I think a Realism Hub in the forums would help encourage discussions, exchanges, mod development, issue detecting/fixing, tutorials, story-telling, social bonding/connecting etc. for all of us who only really care for the Realistic KSP.

I started thinking in this idea while following the RO Discussion Thread, in which I see people posting crashes/bugs, stories and mission reports, design queries and ideas, etc. etc. indistinctly. I find it quite hard to follow it and track the content I'm interested in (in my case alone, I already have RSS/RO working so I might not be as interested in other people's technical issues but design discussions, craft exchanges, compatible mods, etc.). Basically I think the aforementioned thread is now holding a multitude of different type of posts that I think would be good to have them separated & organized.

Concluding, I think this Realism Hub would be a great addition to the forums. We could track RSS/RO compatible mods (which I'm always out on the look for), discuss building/design techniques without having to worry to specify all the time that we work under the RSS/RO suite, share our stories and mission plans, post challenges and defy other players and have an organized sub-forum for technical aid (between RO & RSS' Visual Enhancements threads, the amount of technical issues and people asking the same things over and over again without providing the minimum information for those experienced users to help them is excruciating and I can't imagine what's like for @NathanKell, @pingopete and the rest of the guys that are always willingly trying to help every single day [we super thank you for that guys, you are pillars of this community which I am just trying to begin to be a part of!!!]).

Hopefully you agree with me and we can get this going on! I also offer myself to provide any help in creating/maintaining such a structure as it is deemed necessary.

Thanks everyone for being this great! I love this game!!!

 

Edited January 29, 2016 by pvnkb1tch
I like this idea! Not an RSS user yet, but planning to start in 1.1.
We already have a discussion thread about RSS/RO/RP-0 but if you want you can proceed with this one .

17 hours ago, Phineas Freak said:

We already have a discussion thread about RSS/RO/RP-0 but if you want you can proceed with this one .

Hi Phineas  yup, I know we do have that discussion thread, however my idea was more oriented to a sub-forum than a single thread. It's mainly for organization purposes; i.e. I see in that discussion thread many many different types of posts (technical issues, design ideas/queries, mission stories/descriptions, queries regarding compatible mods, etc. etc.) and I just thought it would be better and would drive added value to have a specific subforum for all RSS/RO/RP-0 things related  just a humble thought though, if everyone's doing fine with that single thread then that's OK
At first I was iffy, but now that I think about it, RO is so big and has so many mods in it I think it might be helpful to have its own subforum. This thread might do better in kerbal network though.
I like this! I can make a thread about it in the Kerbal Network. It will also include a poll.
guys, glad you think this way!! poll is up by legoclone09 @ http://forum.kerbalspaceprogram.com/index.php?/topic/131082-realism-overhaulrss-subforum-in-add-on-discussions/
